property.name: RowIndex
property.description:
Type: "N",
Mode: "R",
Default = -1. Row index of the current row.

property.name: ColumnInfo
property.description:
Type: "P",
Mode: "R",
An array of column descriptions of type SQL::DataTypeInfo.

property.name: ColumnCount
property.description:
Type: "N",
Mode: "R",
Default = -1. The number of columns in the result set.

property.name: DBFRowSyntax
property.description:
Type: "C",
Mode: "R",
Default = "". The syntax required to create an Alpha Anywhere .DBF table with the same columns.

property.name: RowIndexOnPage
property.description:
Type: "N",
Mode: "RW",
Default = -1. Row index of the current row with respect to the current page of data.This value is used mainly for formatting expressions, where the row is passed in as a parameter.The row is set manually or through the creation of the object in SQL::ResultSet::FormatData().

methodref.name: DataIsNull
methodref.description: Determine whether a given element is Null.

section.description: A SQL::ResultSet object will contain one or more SQL::Row objects. The following script retrieves data into a SQL::ResultSet, extracts a SQL::Row with SQL::ResultSet.NextRow(), then lists the properties of one of the row's SQL::DataTypeInfo objects.
section.example: dim conn as SQL::Connection dim rs as SQL::ResultSet dim cr as SQL::Row dim dti as SQL::DataTypeInfo dim connString as C dim select_exp as C connString = "{A5API='Access', FileName='c:\program files\a5v8\mdbfiles\alphasports.mdb'}" select_exp = "select Lastname from customer where bill_state_region = 'ma'" if .not. conn.open(connString) ui_msg_box("Error", conn.CallResult.text) end end if if .not. conn.execute(select_exp) ui_msg_box("Error", conn.CallResult.text) conn.close() end end if rs = conn.ResultSet rs.NextRow() cr = rs.CurrentRow dti = cr.ColumnInfo[1] ui_msg_box("Column One Definition", property_to_string(dti)) conn.close()
